intro: Zymum madagascarense, commonly known as the Madagascar zymum, is a rare flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
